comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Edmund K. Stallo, a lawyer from Cincinnati; his father John Bernard Stallo (1823-1900) was US Ambassador to Italy; his wife Beatrice McDonald was the only surviving child of Scottish-born oil baron Alexander McDonald. They had two daughters, Helena and Laura, before Beatrice died in 1895. Edmund didn't handle his daughters' inheritance very well: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dalvay-by-the-sea Edmund married again, to Mrs. May Harrington Hanna, and divorced in 1912. He married a third time, in 1919, to Mrs. Clarissa Cook, a shipbuilder's daughter. Helena Stallo married a French nobleman, and Laura married an Italian prince. But both daughters' husbands left when their fortunes were lost, and Helena died at 38, from cancer, in straitened circumstances. Edmund's father's Wikipedia entry: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Stallo

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: pennylrichardsca:  Thanks for the additional information about Stallo.  We'll include some of it in the description next time we update.
